Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Bowl
Description: As always, this example of a bowl is rather deep and hemispherical with a rounded lip in the continuation of the body. The clay is fine but common, compact, orange and well polished, except on the lower section of the exterior where it is simply brushed. The rim is adorned with a circle made with red ochre paint.
